page.title: 01The Wolfords and Todenham
page.content: This block, on the fringe of the Cotswolds, covers the three small rural communities of Little Wolford and Great Wolford in Warwickshire and part of Todenham in Gloucestershire. The three villages are set in rolling farmland bounded by trees and hedges with patches of woodland. The three small streams which drain the area flow north to join the river Stour just out of the block. There are good communications with other areas as the main Oxford to Stratford road passes to the east of Little Wolford. However, although these villages are only a mile apart they are quite separate communities. The two Wolfords share some activities but have few links with Todenham.
